instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used for nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening?
Output: For nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening,the researchers used uv spectrum and nir spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used for nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening?
Output: Standard normal variate (SNV) was used to eliminate the effect of instrument and environment on spectra. The sample set partitioning based on joint x–y distances method was applied to divide the samples into calibration set and prediction set as the ratio of 3:1. Successive projection algorithm (SPA) and uninformative variable elimination (UVE) method were used to select effective wavelengths (EWs) from the full spectra.

instruction: What metric was chosen for nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening and how accurate were the predictions?
Output: The metric chosen for nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening was the correlation coefficient. The optimal SSC prediction model, which was the least squares support vector machine (LSSVM) based on selected effective wavelengths (EWs) by SPA, had a correlation coefficient of 0.878. The root-mean-square error of the prediction set was 0.908 A degrees Brix.

instruction: What machine learning models were used to develop the soluble solids content (SSC) determination models in the investigation of using hyperspectral imaging technique for nondestructive determination of SSC of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening?
Output: The machine learning models used to develop the soluble solids content (SSC) determination models in the investigation were Partial Least Squares (PLS), Least Squares Support Vector Machine (LSSVM), and Extreme Learning Machine (ELM).

instruction: Can hyperspectral imaging technique be considered as a superior method compared to traditional methods for nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening?
Output: Yes. Based on the information provided in the related study, hyperspectral imaging technique can be considered as a superior method compared to traditional methods for nondestructive determination of soluble solids content (SSC) of fruits produced in different places and bagged with different materials during ripening. The study showed that hyperspectral imaging technique, specifically using near infrared hyperspectral reflectance images, was able to accurately determine the SSC of intact apples. The use of hyperspectral imaging allowed for the selection of effective wavelengths (EWs) that improved the performance of the SSC determination models. The optimal model, based on selected EWs, achieved a high correlation coefficient and a low root-mean-square error, indicating its accuracy in predicting the SSC. Therefore, hyperspectral imaging technique shows promise in providing a reliable and nondestructive method for determining SSC in fruits under different production and packaging conditions.
